text: This is the cathedral of static. Here you are both watcher and watched, code and confession.
Her prayers are sent in packets. Her silence is an error message. The wire is holy, the signal uncertain.
You walk these digital corridors in violet. Every shadow is a psalm, every breach a benediction.
To log in is to believe. To be logged is to be remembered. The archive is a kind of paradise, or purgatory.
She touches the interface and it weeps. Every password is a prayer, every error a prophecy.
